definition[0]: a part of a written law or legal document covering a particular subject of the whole law or document
example[0]: A confidentiality clause was added to the contract.
definition[1]: a group of words that contains a subject and a verb, but which is usually only part of a sentence
definition[2]: a part of a written law, contract, or legal document that deals with a particular item or subject
example[1]: Clause 12 enables the Secretary of State to make orders to protect pension rights.
